meanings.definition: Move forward on hands and knees.
meanings.sent1: The baby was crawling towards the toy.
meanings.sent2: The cat was crawling along the fence.
meanings.sent3: The ants were crawling all over the picnic blanket.
meanings.sent4: Time was crawling by as we waited for the bus.
meanings.sent5: The spider was crawling up the wall, its legs moving slowly.

meanings.sent1: She was crawling through the narrow cave passage.
meanings.sent2: The old dog was crawling up the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The snail was crawling at a snail's pace.
meanings.sent4: The fog was crawling over the mountains, enveloping everything.
meanings.sent5: The wounded soldier was crawling to safety, inch by inch.

meanings.definition: Covered with or full of crawling insects.
meanings.sent1: The rotten log was crawling with beetles.
meanings.sent2: The dark basement was crawling with spiders.
meanings.sent3: The picnic area became crawling with ants after the food was left out.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house was crawling with cockroaches, a truly creepy sight.
meanings.sent5: The forest floor was crawling with insects of all shapes and sizes.
